questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Customer Service administrator.
You are configuring a case dashboard.
You need to filter the dashboard to show only escalated cases and cases that are marked as Request.
Which filter should you use?

discussion.content:
Global is correct 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/configure-interactive-dashboards-customer-service-hub

Selected Answer: C
Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/customer-service-hub-user-guide-dashboard

Selected Answer: C
Global Filter has "Is Escalated" option.

Selected Answer: B
Correct, we can setup Global Filter to filter out the cases.
Correct. Directly lifted from https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/configure-interactive-dashboards-customer-service-hub

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You need to build a personal dashboard that displays the following charts and views:
Charts:
✑ Number of cases by owner and priority
✑ Products with most cases opened
Views:
✑ Display the number of cases opened in a seven-day period
✑ Display the number of escalated cases
Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct answer (I think)
Answer is correct
I think its 5,2,1,6 (open dashboard, create dashboard, create charts and view, select the graph icon to insert chart and views)

comments.content:
My bad, rrodrguez is correct. 
1. open dashboard, 
2. create dashboard, 
3. select the graph icon to insert chart and views
4. create charts and view,

discussion.content:
1- open dashboards and select new
2- create a two-colummns regular dashboard
3- select the graph icon to insert the chatrs and views needed in the sections of the dashboard
4- create the charts and views necessary to see the data requested

comments.content: I agree with @Kyol, you cannot create a dashboards with charts and views you haven't created yet.
How can you add charts you haven't made yet?
You click Add view and since you haven't found the one you need from the same window, you Add new view, save and you are back to window where you choose the view to be added to the dashboard.

questions.question_text:
You are implementing Dynamics 365 Customer Service Insights.
The product manager would like to see product sales trends by age group. The groupings are as follows:
✑ Ages 18 and younger
✑ Ages 19-25
✑ Ages 26-40
✑ Ages 41-55
✑ Ages 56 and older
You need to configure the system.
What should you define?

discussion.content:
Feels more like a segment to me?

"Segments let you group your customers based on demographic, transactional, or behavioral attributes."
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/audience-insights/segments
Measure is the correct one because segment allows you to GROUP YOUR CUSTOMERS while measure helps you calculate the total sales by those groups.

Selected Answer: C
Segment: Segments are used to group data based on specific criteria or attributes. In this case, you want to segment your data based on age groups, which makes "segment" the correct choice.

Selected Answer: C
C. You can create segments in CS Insights:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/segments?tabs=b2c

C. segment
To analyze product sales trends by age group in Dynamics 365 Customer Service Insights, you would need to define a segment. A segment is a grouping of customers based on common attributes, such as age group in this case. Once you define the segment, you can use it to analyze measures, such as product sales, for the specific age groups. Activities represent interactions between customers and agents, measures are the metrics being analyzed, and members are individual customers or cases within a segment.
Defo Segment
customer service insights is not the same as customer insight (provided in the link)
It's measure

Segment is require.
We dont need to calculate anything. (avg, sum, etc)
We have to create many group.

choices.C: Connect Customer Service Insights to a Power BI environment.
choices.A: Add an agent permission role to the required users.
choices.E: Connect Customer Service Insights to a Common Data Service environment.
choices.B: Add a viewer permission role to the required users.
choices.D: Share the connected workspace with the required users.

questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Customer Service Insights.

Users need to understand customer data in more detail.

You need to complete the initial configuration of the workspaces.

Which three tasks should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Assume this is to provide access in Power BI for users to view the data there in the Power BI workspace.

Selected Answer: BDE
BDE as you have to integrate customer insights with dataverse environment. There's also no mention in the question about having Power BI
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/customer-insights-dataverse

comments.content: But workspace is related to PowerBI, right?

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You are creating a bar chart that displays the 10 help desk representatives who are resolving the most cases.

You need to ensure that all team members can view the chart. You do not have share privileges.

How should you configure the chart? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//
